alert.note: Alert for Ponce; Salinas; Santa Isabel (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 9:44PM ADT until July 09 at 1:45AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Guayama, Juana Diaz, Ponce, Salinas and Santa Isabel. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms which continue to redevelop and move inland across these areas. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Excessive runoff may also affect rivers and small streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ponce, Guayama, Santa Isabel, Salinas, Juana Diaz, Los Llanos, Las Ollas, Jauca, Potala Pastillo, Guayabal, Coco, Luis Llorens Torres, Aguilita, Capitanejo, Vazquez, Coto Laurel, Coqui, Jobos, Olimpo and Corazon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
